pages.text: All strange, magical things in life somehow seem to involve some kind of ritual performed on a set of pedestals. I imagine magicians and wizards have to attend some kind of magic college where they are being told in no misunderstood terms that if they want to perform magic tricks, it had better involve a circle of pedestals.

Anyway, I digress. The master leprechaun magician I witnessed performing rituals was no different. I saw him place down a stone pedestal, and surround them with up to 8 wood pedestals nearby to place items on. Activating a ritual was done by using the clover staff (see my other notes) on the center pedestal. To see what you can craft using this ritual, look up the center pedestal item, and $(italic)use$() it to pull up all recipes.

The lazier amongst us will be pleased to know that the ritual can also be performed by giving the stone pedestal a redstone signal. Pedestals can be hooked up the usual way to transfer items in and out.
